name: gloriously
content:
gloriously adverb
(VERY PLEASANT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to emphasize how good something is or how much pleasure it gives: They looked gloriously happy. They windsurfed on gloriously deserted beaches.
used to emphasize how beautiful something is: a gloriously restored 12th century church
used to emphasize how pleasant and sunny the weather is: We've had gloriously sunny weather.
More examplesFewer examplesBhutan is a gloriously unspoiled land of thick forests and misty mountains.The book is gloriously illustrated.She exaggerates the role to gloriously comic effect.She said it sounded like a "gloriously splendid" idea.We set out under a gloriously blue sky.
